dialogues.text: Gordy disembarks amid the throng of passengers, when the FAT FEDERALE confronts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Pitt? Gordy looks up in surprise at him and the thin federale backing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us, please. He clamps a hand on Gordy's arm. Gordy shakes it off and starts running. Almost immediately, he's tackled to the ground by the thin federale. Two more federales join in. Gordy's not gonna go down easy, though. Even as only one against four, Gordy's a formidable challenge. He's strong, and he's committed all the way. He's not getting kicked out of this country again. It's not a clean or artful fight. There's no karate. It's four men trying to tackle a bull, and... The bull gets away.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Gordy sprints down streets with the federales in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: jukes into a local bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy pounds out the back of the bar into a littered courtyard, where he's surrounded by ten-foot walls.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERALES
dialogues.text: blast through the bar.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: runs, jumps, launches off a beer keg, and...

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF WALL
dialogues.text: He reaches the top of the wall and pulls himself up. He's looking out across a block-long run of corrugated tin roofs. Takes off across the roofs, each step thundering, as...

dialogues.speaker: FEDERALES
dialogues.text: burst into the courtyard. Two men hastily build a stack of boxes, etc., against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: runs as fast as he can across the rooftops, when... A section of roof gives way beneath his feet, just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the federales finally mounts the wall, looks across the rooftops... and Gordy's gone.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: lands inside a warehouse room amid sacks of rice, beans and coffee. The building is dark and dusty. He lies still and listens. FOOTSTEPS approach across the tin roof overhead. Gordy burrows into the bags of rice, pulls them over him.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERALE
dialogues.text: on the roof peers down through the hole. Scans the warehouse room below with a mini-Mag-Lite.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: sees the flashlight beam move past. He holds his breath. Beat. Then the FOOTSTEPS pass on, RECEDE down the roof. And Gordy can breathe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy makes his way along the main drag of the frontier town. A noisy, neon-lit strip of bars and brothels. Everyone's packing a gun. A new Dodge City, where death squad sicarios cruise past in 4x4's BLARING SALSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, the MUSIC'S LOUD ROCK 'N' ROLL. Gringo music for a gringo bar. The place is busy, with plenty of local "hostesses" for the men. Even Armstrong, standing half-crocked at the bar, is flanked by two scantily-clad women. He's got a spoon hanging off his nose. So does one of the girls. Armstrong's trying to hang a spoon on the other. Gordy slips into the bar. Spots Armstrong through the crowd. Sees Armstrong's not wearing his cap, when... The girl with the spoon on her nose turns slightly, revealing she's wearing the cap. It's on backwards, but now Gordy can see the "Deerborn" logo clearly. Gordy wants the guerrilla travel pass inside the cap. It's a desperate move, but he's got no choice. Starts toward the girl, when... Gordy sees the thin federale enter the front door. The thin federale sees him at the same time. Begins moving in on him. Gordy moves faster toward the girl.   And... The girl unwittingly does him a favor by taking off the cap and setting it on the bar, where it's easier to grab, and then turns her attention to Armstrong's antics. The thin detective fights through the crowd after Gordy. Gordy's almost to the hat.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Armstrong's still having trouble with the second girl's spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never met a nose I couldn't hang a spoon on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy reaches the bar, snags the cap. Glances back, sees the thin federale closing in, turns to run out the back, when... A strong hand stops him. The hand belongs to the Fat Federale. And now the thin federale's there, too, wielding a stun gun where Gordy can see it. People in the bar fall silent. Everyone but Armstrong, who's finally hung the spoon on the second girl's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahtzee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Armstong also realizes something's up. Turns and sees Gordy. Sees the cap in Gordy's hand as the Fat Federale addresses Gordy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along, Mr. Pitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereupon Armstrong shouts drunkenly at Gordy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police catch you trying to steal my hat, you asshole?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He staggers toward Gordy.    Grabs the hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking hat thief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong takes a drunken swing at Gordy, but... Instead of hitting Gordy, Armstrong accidentally-on- purpose clocks the fat detective. Then hisses into Gordy's ear, clearly not that drunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Armstrong's legs won't work as the thin federale jams the stun gun against his neck, and 10,000 volts surprise the Armstrong neural network. Gordy moves against the thin federale in anger, when... The Fat Federale ZAPS him with another STUN GUN, just behind the ear... And Gordy gets to know the floor, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building's ancient, constructed of wood and adobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jail might be old, but the cells are secure enough. They're also unsanitary and thoroughly unpleasant. Gordy and Armstrong are led in by the federales. The Fat Federale has Armstrong's hat. He looks it over, wondering why Gordy wanted it. Then decides he could give a fuck and tosses it to Armstrong. Clangs the cell door shut and locks it. Leaves shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gringos... Armstrong's still unsteady on his feet and sits down on the metal bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stun gun wasn't cool. Armstrong looks down at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't peed my pants in a real long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have helped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I guess all these assholes down here are just starting on my nerves. Gordy's silent.   It's over.   He's come up short.   He's going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell did you do to land us in here? And don't jerk me around, eh? Beat.   Gordy sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf killed my wife and son in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh, you're that guy, eh? I'm sorry, man... And what, you came down here to even things out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you even have a plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Go to Caguan, find The Wolf and kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong just shakes his head.    Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR TO CELL AREA
dialogues.text: BANGS open. Federales lead in two men -- the two guerrillas surprised earlier by the heavy-camouflaged infiltrators. The federales are armed with batons and stun guns, taking no chances. It's clear the rebels weren't brought here without a struggle, either -- both are cut and bruised. The tougher-looking of the two has taken a real beating. This beaten man is jammed face- first against the bars of Gordy's cell. He makes eye contact with Gordy while the other rebel is unbound and put into a cell. Then the beaten man is shoved into the cell. A solid, brick wall separates them from Gordy and Armstrong. Armstrong's seen the patches on their uniforms. To Gordy, sotto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.L.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Armstrong sees the look on Gordy's face.      By wa of a warning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't kill them, don't even talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUERRILLAS are MURMURING in the other cell. One of them LAUGHS. OFF Gordy, listening to the LAUGHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two or three A.M. Armstrong's dozing. Gordy's still listening to the MURMURING of the REBELS on the other side of the wall, when...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There's a flurry of activity outside the cell area.   The door opens. Soldiers enter with some federales. Gordy watches the soldiers move past his cell.    Rocha i with them. And then... Brandt appears at the bars, looks in at Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy stands, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We asked you to leave it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you guys still haven't got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over yet... The guys next door are in The Wolf's elite bodyguard unit. Where he goes, they go. We're gonna ask questions. And we're gonna get answers... And you're staying right here till our bomber's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt goes. Moments later, a TORTURED SCREAM is heard on the other side of the brick wall, waking Armstrong with a start.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: In a field near Mompos, a canopied truck backs into position. Men in guerrilla uniforms with ELC patches get out and pull back the canopy, revealing mortar tubes pointing skyward on a bed of sand.

dialogues.speaker: ELC GUERRILLA
dialogues.text: unit armed with AK-47s and Light Anti-Tank Weapons (LAWs) infiltrates the town.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TWO-MAN ELC GUERRILLA TEAM
dialogues.text: sets up a single mortar position overlooking the town. One of the men checks his watch. Beat. He signals. The other man drops a MORTAR down the tube. WHUMP.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORTARS
dialogues.text: go in the tubes on the truck.   WHUMP, WHUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! A water tower, the Mompos fire station and the town's power supply are direct hits. WHUMP, WHUMP, WHUMP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People react to the sounds of the MORTAR ATTACK on the town. The lights go out. Brandt, Rocha and their men quickly lock the guerrillas in their cell and head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MORTARS CONTINUE to fall on the rest of the town, the unit of guerrilla infiltrators open up on the front of the jail with LAW ROCKETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM! The front door and wall of the jail disintegrate under the multiple LAW attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt, Rocha and the soldiers, approaching the front door inside, are hammered by the massive concussion of the BLAST and flung across the room, apparently dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powerful, concussive shock-wave channels into the cell area. Gordy's slightly protected by a wall. Armstrong, standing at the bars, is thrown into the opposite wall and knocked unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLAS
dialogues.text: charge inside with AKs BLAZING.   Surviving soldiers and federales SHOOT back. The blasts have caused fires in the building. Severed wires spark, creating more fire. Flames begin to spread through the tinder-dry structure.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guerrillas take out the soldiers and federales, with few casualties to themselves. They make their way toward the cell area. EXPLODING AMMO and stored FUEL CANS accelerate the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guerrillas reach the cells. Two men see Gordy and draw down on him. The others move to the next cell. Guerrillas plant small explosive charges on the hinges of the cell containing their two captured comrades. Beat. The HINGES BLOW. The beaten man and the rebel with him are freed, and the guerrillas quickly retreat the way they came. Gordy sees flames spreading into the cell area.

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLAS
dialogues.text: exit the fiery jail past Brandt.    We see Brandt's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck pulls up. The guerrillas get in.    The TRUCK SCREECHES OUT as...

dialogues.speaker: 4X4
dialogues.text: full of sicarios SKIDS onto the street, far ahead of the truck. The sicario driving punches it, and...

dialogues.speaker: TWO TRUCKS
dialogues.text: ROAR toward each other. A game of chicken. With GUNS. Men in both vehicles OPEN UP -- the sicarios with magnums and Uzis, the guerrillas with AKs. SLUGS RIP through automotive steel. Casualties are taken. When...

dialogues.speaker: SICARIO
dialogues.text: driving the 4x4 receives a round in the forehead, cranks over the steering wheel, and...

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDING 4X4
dialogues.text: does a Paris-to-Dakar road rally flip, twisting and somersaulting, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 4x4 catapults completely over the guerrillas' truck, disintegrating into spare parts and dead occupants, as...

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLAS
dialogues.text: ROAR off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A severely-dazed Brandt, bleeding from the nose and ears, slowly gets to his knees, crawls out of the burning building and collapses outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's fire and smoke everywhere. Gordy picks up the metal bunk and slams it against a wall. Slams it again. Breaks the metal apart. Then levers a long side rail in the cell door. He heaves. Heaves again. The fire's licking at him, but Gordy's undeterred. He heaves again, and... This time, the door gives. Gordy picks up Armstrong's cap, then picks up Armstrong, who's starting to come around. Puts Armstrong over his shoulders in a fireman's carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) You're not running through the fire, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because running through the fire is just what Gordy's gonna do. As he disappears into the flames...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town's in complete chaos.         There are fires everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Still stunned and bleeding, Brandt looks from where he lies on the ground as... Gordy bursts out of the inferno carrying Armstrong. They're singed and smoking, but they're alive. Gordy drops Armstrong, pats himself and Armstrong down, knocking out the burning embers on their clothes and hair, when... Gordy's eyes meet Brandt's. The two men hold the look for a moment. If Brandt could speak, he'd be yelling at Gordy to stop, not to go on. And Gordy knows it. But Gordy's not stopping. Picks up Armstrong again and moves off toward the waterfront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's less chaos here.    The fires are in the distance Gordy arrives carrying Armstrong.    Sets him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find a boat to take us upriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go.    Armstrong stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I told you. The pass is only good for one person. And you're too dangerous to travel with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Gordy reaches over and takes Armstrong's cap.     H looks inside. There's no pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't been there since we landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's at a loss. He tosses the cap back.      Just look at Armstrong. Beat. Armstrong sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, hell... I was through with this place anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off a boot. Shakes out some money and the pass. He hands the pass to Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call ahead and tell Felix I'm not coming, and you're my replacement. He'll meet you in Caguan and take you to the plantation... What do you know about diesel engines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the fire trucks are diesels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to be Austrian, eh? They hate Americans. Name's gotta change, too, in case they're watching the news. (beat) It'll buy you a little time to look around Caguan. But you'll never find The Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   Gordy sticks out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heinrich Beckmann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Austrian name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong shakes hands with Gordy.     Armstrong doesn't let loose right away. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck got you this far. But up there, luck doesn't make it. I hope you know you're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Gordy, about to step over another line...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: As dawn breaks over the river, FIND Gordy sitting in a motored panga being steered by a local BOATMAN. Gordy reaches into a pocket and pulls out the photo of Anne and Matt. He looks at it for a few moments. Then pockets it again.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The panga passes a dead body floating downstream.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The panga passes revolutionary banners and signs lining the riverbank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La zona guerrillera.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The panga rounds a bend, and... Two souped-up bass boats filled with heavily-armed ELC guerrillas move to intercept it. The Boatman slows, puts the panga in neutral and keeps his hands in sight. One boat of guerrillas pulls alongside. The other sheers off and stops a short distance away, ready to open fire. Gordy shows the guerrillas his travel pass. One of them takes it. Reads. Looks Gordy over. Then starts to rip the pass in half, when... He stops. Grins. It's a big joke. He hands back the pass, searches the boat quickly and waves the panga on. OFF Gordy's relief as the panga heads on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panga arrives, and Gordy gets out. He's met by FELIX. Felix has a 9mm in a shoulder holster. Felix doesn't look the least bit happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beckmann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Felix leads him towards a Land Cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong should have called sooner. We don't like changes here... If I didn't need the equipment fixed, I'd send you back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They reach the Land Cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now we have to see the E.L.C. Supervisor for Caguan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a prospect that seems to concern Felix almost as much as Gordy. Off which, as they get into the Toyota...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELC SUPERVISOR for Caguan may be a Marxist, but the clean, well-ordered office is nicely appointed, with a big-screen Sony and leather furniture. The TV's TUNED TO CNN. A photo on the wall depicts him as a younger man wearing guerrilla cammies bearing with an ELC patch and holding an AK-47. A brass nameplate reading "Supervisor" rests on a neat desk, behind which stands the man himself -- a hardened, former guerrilla fighter proud of his position. He's not in cammies now -- his uniform now consists of casual but nice tropical clothing and a fat Rolex. Felix is a subordinate here. He and Gordy stand across the desk as the Supervisor examines Gordy's travel pass. Gordy's nervous about what could appear on the TV in the b.g., but tries not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your passport was stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Mompos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mompos is a shithole. Not like Caguan... Why didn't Armstrong come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was arrested in Ecuador. He got drunk and fooled around with a police officer's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Supervisor just looks at him, assessing Gordy's face for signs he's lying. Gordy's expression stays the same. Felix respectfully interjects.     It's almost a plea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) We need to fix the equipment. We have delivery deadlines to meet.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A long beat. The ELC Supervisor hands the travel pass back to Gordy. In a hard tone to Felix --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) He's your responsibility. Don't let him out of your sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.   Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Felix leads Gordy away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Felix pull away from the Supervisor's H.Q. Felix resumes his former tone of command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Supervisor made you my responsibility... You don't go anywhere without me, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy peers out the window intently as they drive, looking for a lucky break, looking for The Wolf, searching the face of every man. He doesn't see The Wolf, but what he does see surprises him. The ELC Supervisor was right: Caguan's no Mompos. It's a third- world town, armed troops are visible, and there's a lot of bad shit behind Colombia's revolutionaries, but here the streets are calm and orderly. It's quiet, almost eerie, as people go about their business. OFF Gordy, seeing another side of the guerrillas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix turns off at the entrance to a lane leading to the plantation. The entrance is guarded by a 4X4 "Rat Patrol" assault truck and four heavily armed ELC guerrillas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.L.C. guards your coffee beans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix thinks he's joking. Until he looks over and sees Gordy's actually being sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Coffee beans? Shit. Armstrong didn't tell you much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach a hacienda and outbuildings. The accoutrements of agriculture are present -- tractors, sheds, cats, etc. -- but clearly, this is no family farm. There are lots of serious-looking men around. More ELC guerrillas stand guard.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: stops the car. He and Gordy get out. Felix begins leading Gordy toward two rows of long, open-walled sheds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem's with the diesel generators. The sons-of-bitches keep breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass four very large pits, where green leaves steep in a thick, foul-smelling liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're using portables to keep production going, but they don't supply enough power to the heat lamps, and we have to dry a lot of... 'coffee beans.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're now walking between the two rows of sheds, where portable gas GENERATORS THRUM, and... Gordy can see long, wide platforms inside. Above the platforms are multiple arrays of powerful heat lamps. Spread out and drying beneath them is a half-acre or two of converted cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER SHED
dialogues.text: workers pack and wrap one-kilo bricks of coke for shipment.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY AND FELIX
dialogues.text: approach the two giant diesel generators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can fix anything, but these keep dying on us... You'll start now. I'll have tools brought to you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong's a magician with them. Let's hope you have his skill. Felix walks over to a guerrilla with an AK-47 and speaks to him. Then goes. Whereupon the guerrilla crosses to Gordy and takes up a sentry position over him.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Gordy has the diesels partially dismantled. The guerrilla sentry is still right there. Felix returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Gordy has to think of something fast.    Beat.   He throw machine part against a wall angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't work with these pieces of junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junk? These generators cost a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then treat them that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong always fixes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong wants your money. He makes them work, but he doesn't fix them... To do this right, we gotta order parts from Europe. In the meantime, I can make something temporary. There must be a machine shop in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gordy stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Felix, forced to acquiesce...

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: Felix is driving. Again, Gordy uses the opportunity to look for The Wolf. It's a long-shot, and he knows it. But it's all he can do.

dialogues.speaker: EMPTY STOREFRONT
dialogues.text: They pass an empty storefront. A sign on the large, front plate glass window says "Cine" and "Sabado."

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: They pass a bar. Felix watches it go by with something like a look of desire. Gordy registers the look and the connection to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Gordy selects spare parts. A clerk wraps the parts in an old newspaper, and... Gordy realizes his picture is on the paper.       He smea grease from his hands over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy finishes loading the parts into the Land Cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty. How about you?   Want to get something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix pauses. We see the look of desire again. Gordy's definitely struck a chord. But Felix quickly stifles it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working all day out in the sun. I need a drink... nice cold beer? How about it? I saw a bar in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix really wants to, but still hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the spare parts, I'll have the generators running in two hours... We have time for a couple beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Just a beer. Maybe two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've had a lot more than two beers. Felix has, anyway. He's drunk. He's also in love with a waitress on his lap, a cute gordita named BERTA. He pats her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is mine. This is the reason I come here... right, Berta? Me amas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing along) Si, amor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody whistles for a drink, and Berta goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... She's hot, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat.    Gordy makes the play he's been contemplatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong said to watch my butt around here. I guess the fucking Americans come down and shoot everyone all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially now, since the bomb in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard about it.   Who did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix is just loose enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf, and they'll never catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; eyes Gordy) If you know too much around here, it can get you killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's gotten all he'll get from Felix.     He feigns nonchalance, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what doesn't get you killed around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy takes a swig of beer.      When... Gordy sees the Beaten Man from the jail in Mompos. man has just walked in with another guerrilla. Gordy barely avoids being seen as the guerrillas cross the room. At the bar, the bartender puts out two crates of beer. The guerrillas take the beer and head out. No money's changed hands. When they're gone, to Felix --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better get back, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) ... Shit. It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guerrillas are just driving away in a big- wheeled, high ground-clearance Suburban as Gordy and Felix emerge. Felix is weaving.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gordy keeps his eyes on the Suburban's tail lights and opens the Land Cruiser's passenger door for Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too drunk. I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy gets in. Felix hands Gordy the keys.        Then sl against his door and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, I'm going to screw Berta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy STARTS the CAR and drives after the Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy follows the Suburban as Felix rambles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll take her to a small restaurant... We'll have lobster and drink lots of wine... I'll get her drunk... We'll drive home... I'll carry her inside... I'll kiss her... And then, I'll screw her in my bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban pulls up next to a house.       There are ar guerrilla guards outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And when I am done screwing her, she'll never want to look at another man again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy drives past the house as the Beaten Man and the guerrilla with him get out of the Suburban and start carrying the beer inside. And a moment later... Felix comes around with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unholsters the 9mm and points it at Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, easy... What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going the wrong goddamn way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am?... Looks different in the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy turns the car around.     Felix keeps the gun on hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive where I say... Or the Supervisor will have us both shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy drives back. They approach the Suburban and the house once more. This time it's on Felix' side. Felix gives the guerrilla guards a wave as they go by, and... Gordy's eyes go to something he couldn't see coming the other way: a large propane tank next to the house.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The work in the sheds continues.    Heat lamps dry down t long tables of coke.

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLA GUARDS
dialogues.text: are more vigilant at night, patrolling the grounds with posted teams.

dialogues.speaker: WORK LIGHTS
dialogues.text: illuminate the two big diesel generators as Gordy continues his overhaul. He has two sentries now. One wears a combat vest, and as Gordy works, his eyes go to the grenades hanging on the vest's front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun's over the yardarm now, blazing hot, and Gordy's still working under the watchful eyes of the guards. Nearby, a group of guerrillas is playing soccer, when...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A man is injured, and his teammates call for one of Gordy's guards to substitute. The man in the combat vest responds. The game is shirts and skins, and he's joining the skins. Puts down his AK, strips off his combat vest and shirt, and runs in. Gordy's eyes go to the vest and the attached grenades. With the other guard still watching him closely, however, there's nothing Gordy can do.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The soccer game rages back and forth. Suddenly, an open man gets the ball. Breaks toward the goal. Gordy sees the player about to go one-on-one with the goalie. He cheers the action loudly, whereupon... Gordy's guard turns to see what's happening, and... Gordy grabs a grenade.    Almost gets it into a tool box, when... The player kicks wide, the guard looks back, and... Gordy covers the clattering of the grenade's dropping into the tool box by picking up a large wrench... But the grenade's still visible as now... Felix comes around the corner. He's sleepy and hungover. And pissed by Gordy's lack of progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's afternoon. Yesterday, you said it would only take two more hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy wipes his hands on a rag, throws it on the grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this one ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy reaches up and hits the start button on the GENERATOR. It SPUTTERS, but won't catch. Felix just looks at him. Gordy makes an adjustment, and... This time,   the ENGINE TURNS OVER. PURRS like new. The heat lamps   brighten in a row of sheds. Felix winces as the DIESEL   ROAR makes the hangover hammers in his head pound even   harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need another part from town, and it's five more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Shit.     Fine. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy grabs the tool box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you bringing the tool box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old part's in there. I need to match it, and it's all greasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix buys it and heads off.          As Gordy follows hi

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: They pass the "Cine" in the storefront. The ELC Supervisor's big-screen TV is being wheeled in.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: sees an attractive woman playing with some children.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY AND FELIX
dialogues.text: drive past the bar.        Gordy notices Felix doesn't ev glance at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berta working today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!   Puta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that, whatever this means, it's an unexpected complication for Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Gordy chooses the spare part. The clerk wraps the part in newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy loads the part into the Land Cruiser.   To Felix --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You as thirsty as I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Felix gets into the Land Cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy climbs in.   Felix starts driving.   Gordy's down t final straws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stop for one beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's beer at the plantation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no Berta at the plantation. I like drinking beer around pretty girls, not a bunch of guys with automatic rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with Berta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Last night you were in love with her. There's a beat. Felix glances at Gordy.     Decides it's safe to confide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I had a dream... I fed her lobster, got her drunk, and she rejected me for another man. (off Gordy's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams tell the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That wasn't a dream, that was the alcohol talking... You saying two men can't go have a beer and look at women's breasts because of pink elephants?... Nothing makes any sense down here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Felix pulls out his .9mm.    Gordy doesn't blink an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and shoot me, and you fix the goddamn generator. Part's in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   OFF Felix, thinking it all over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A replay of last night. Felix is pretty wasted.    Berta' in his lap again. In Spanish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm your man, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone whistles for a drink. Berta starts to stand. Gordy slips her twenty US dollars to stay. She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy crosses, exits into the bano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy drops out the bathroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy gets the grenade from the tool box. He slides it just inside the top of his pants, with the spoon hooked over the waistband. He finds some wire. Then searches for something else. Finds a piece of string and checks its length. From Gordy's reaction, we understand it's too short. Gordy opens doors and checks seat pockets. Nothing. He checks the glove box. No long string there, either. But he does find two rubber bands. Gordy studies them a moment, thinking. Tests their elasticity. Then pulls out the Zippo and thumbs it. The lighter still works. As Gordy pockets everything and walks off...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gordy steals through town, hiding when he sees someone coming. He's re-tracing the route he took the night before, when he followed the Beaten Man's Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: "CINE"
dialogues.text: He passes the "Cine" in the storefront. A movie's beginning to play on the supervisor's big-screen TV.   Th place is packed. No one sees Gordy, who moves on.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: continues to make his way through Caguan, when... He rounds a corner, and there's a four-man ELC patrol, two in a truck and two out. Gordy turns, starts heading back, when... One of the GUERRILLAS calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alto! Gordy stops. The two standing men walk toward him. The other two men get out of the truck to provide backup. One guerrilla approaching Gordy stops short and stands off, cocked-and-locked, as the other comes up. Gordy carefully produces the travel pass. The guerrilla looks it over. In butchered Spanish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo trabajo con Felix. Felix -- (indicates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- la cantina. Con Berta. The attractive woman we saw earlier playing with the children now walks up holding the hand of a small boy. guerrilla waves them on. The woman and boy hustle by, glancing at the face of this big gringo in trouble as they pass. They hurry on toward the nearby "Cine." OFF Gordy, as the guerrilla indicates for him to start walking to the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guerrilla patrol has taken Gordy to Felix, still sitting with Berta in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to get us both killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went for a walk. I figured you wanted to be alone with Berta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guerrillas; in Spanish) I'll make sure he's on a shorter leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol leader looks at Felix hard. Then nods. The guerrillas go. Felix dumps Berta onto her feet, stands. Felix looks at Gordy, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Felix get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working all night, Beckmann. That generator gets fixed, and you're out of my hair in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix jams the car in drive. Gordy looks down, sees the spoon of the grenade exposed. As he readjusts his shirt to cover the spoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix is right there supervising for himself as Gordy finishes working. Gordy stands. He stares hopefully at the MACHINE. Then pushes the starter, and... VRROOM! The heat lights in the second row of sheds brighten. Gordy turns to Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That make you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get it in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix yanks the dangling cord and turns on the lights. The room's a mess. All kinds of rubbish. There's a washtub sink. There's a cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This where Armstrong stays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you stay... A boat will take you down river at seven. Felix closes the door. We hear a LOCK TURNING. Gordy moves to the door and tries it. It's definitely locked. Through a small window, he can see the lights in the sheds and the ever-vigilant nighttime ELC sentries patrolling the grounds. The DIESELS ROAR in the b.g. Gordy turns back. Readjusts the grenade digging into his belly, then hooks it back inside his pants. He turns off the light. Moves to the adobe wall opposite the door. THROUGH another small window, he can see it's dark in this direction. Gordy rummages through the refuse lying around the room. We see some rubber tubing. We see some rope. Gordy finally finds a piece of sharp metal. He moves to the wall with the window. With the DIESELS covering the noise, Gordy starts chiseling away at the adobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big-wheeled guerrilla Suburban drives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy is making slow progress through the wall, when he hears the VEHICLE arrive. He moves to the window by the door and looks out. Sees the Suburban. Four guerrillas are getting out, including the Beaten Man. Felix meets them. The Beaten Man exchanges words with Felix. Felix indicates Gordy's room. As the Beaten Man continues to question Felix... Gordy realizes he's fucked. He can't get through the wall fast enough. His eyes go to water dripping from a pipe leading to the washtub sink. He moves to it. Finds the water pipe underneath that feeds the tap. Cranks shut the master valve on the pipe. Wraps his hands around the pipe and pulls. Nothing. Jams his feet against the wall for leverage and pulls harder... And this time, he yanks the pipe free from the sink. He finds the rubber hose. Fits an end over the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quickly lashes it on with some wire. Then cranks on the master valve. High-pressure water streams from the hose. Gordy sneaks a peek out the window. The Beaten Man's still questioning Felix. The sound of the hose water is being covered by the DIESELS. Gordy crosses the room, extending the hose to the hole he's made in the wall. He aims the stream at the hole. Thumbs the end of the hose to make the water jet even harder... And watches the jet begin eating away at the old adobe and brick, just as it ate through the crumbling plaster in the Spanish Harlem tenement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beaten Man finishes with Felix. Felix begins leading the guerrillas toward the storeroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's made progress, but hasn't broken through yet. And he won't, not in enough time. Under his breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby... come on, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM-WHAM-WHAM, one of the DIESELS Gordy repaired suffers a spectacularly loud internal breakdown. The heat lights dim in a row of sheds. Felix and the guerrillas stop to see what's happening. At which point, the generator now BURSTS into FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GORDY
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we realize that he'd planned on the diversion, as... The water jet breaks through.      The hole's still small Gordy begins to widen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix, the Beaten Man and the other guerrillas resume their march toward the storeroom. They reach the storeroom. Water's pouring out under the door. Felix unlocks the door and opens it to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's gone. The Beaten Man signals two men to go out the hole. To the other man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organize the others. Find him. The man goes. Outside, we hear him SHOUT orders to the guerrillas guarding the plantation. The Beaten Man turns to Felix. Felix is terrified. In a pleading tone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't be far. You'll catch -- BANG! The Beaten Man SHOOTS Felix in the head. Then exits. OFF Felix, dead, his blood mixing with the water still streaming across the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guerrillas report to the Beaten Man. They can't find Gordy. To the men guarding the plantation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking. He signals his men to come with him.   They get into the Suburban. Whereupon we FIND...

dialogues.speaker: UNDER SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Gordy's hanging onto the chassis. With the large tires and high ground-clearance, there's just enough room to get his legs over the rear axle. He's just finishing rigging up a rope he took from the store room -- the rope's slung from one side of the chassis to the other, to support Gordy's back. He hears the ENGINE START, grabs the transfer case, and...

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: ROARS off with Gordy suspended below. The rear DRIVE SHAFT WHIRS madly, inches from Gordy's face. And, with each bump in the road, even with heavy- duty off-road shocks and springs, the undercarriage of the Suburban comes within inches of crushing Gordy's legs. ROCKS are PINGING everywhere. The dirt and the dust are choking. Even for a short distance, it's going to be a long, dangerous ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TRUCK BLASTS down back roads and through the darkened town...

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: continues to suffer underneath. Even with the rope supporting him, he has to hold on with two hands. A vicious jolt suddenly loosens a grenade. It starts to slip free. Gordy can't stop it without letting go. The grenade falls, and... Gordy shoots out a hand and grabs it. Barely. The spoon just hanging on the end of his fingertips. Gordy can't use his other hand to get it. He needs the hand to hold onto the car. The grenade begins to slip. He's going to lose it. And just as it falls... Gordy does the only thing left. He slips a finger through the loops of the grenade pin. Just barely snags the grenade before it drops to the road. And then... Carefully, slowly -- praying that each bump doesn't jar the grenade off the pin -- with his other arm shaking and screaming in pain as he maintains a grip on the transfer case -- Gordy eases the grenade back onto his stomach, where he gets a better grip. Jams the grenade back. Then grabs onto the undercarriage once more, in time to relieve the muscle-tearing strain on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE GORDY'S WORLD
dialogues.text: the Suburban passes the "Cine."   The movie's over, just letting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suburban pulls up to the well-guarded house Gordy saw the night before. The men get out and go inside, leaving the SUBURBAN RUNNING, clearly planning to leave again right away.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: carefully lowers himself to the ground. Slides out on the side away from the house. Hides behind a large wheel. The brightly-lit house is surrounded by coconut trees. Gordy watches the guards. When the guards aren't looking, he runs to the nearest tree. The sounds of the SUBURBAN'S ENGINE covers his footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: TREES
dialogues.text: Gordy moves from tree to tree when the guards aren't looking, when he reaches one tree, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK!   A coconut hits the ground next to him, and... One of the guards comes to investigate. The guard gets closer. Gordy inches around the tree. He can't get away without being seen. He nudges the coconut with his toe. Nudges it harder, causing it slowly to roll away, and... The guard picks it up. Never sees Gordy in the shadow of the tree, pressed against the trunk. The guard shows the coconut to a guard near the house, then walks back.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: sneaks to another tree. Then reaches the house. He moves to a window. Peers into a room. No one's there. But we hear the sound of VOICES. Gordy creeps along the wall. Looks into another room, and...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: is a group of ELC guerrillas, including the Beaten Man, packing suitcases, etc. Leaving in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: scans the faces. Except for the Beaten Man, no face is familiar. A man with his BACK TO us stands, and there's nothing familiar about him, either. When...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly in front of us, another man emerges from a room. He's also in ELC guerrilla camo.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OFF Gordy, looking intently at the man.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The face of the cop outside the consulate.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: in the room.    His face looms larger as he ADVANCES TOWARDS us.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: when he bumped into Gordy on E. 64th Street.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: in the room.    It's the same face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GORDY
dialogues.text: He's found The Wolf, when... Suddenly, a guard appears, and... Gordy freezes. Eases into the shadows. His dirty face and clothes blend in just enough. The guard moves past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the coast is clear, Gordy moves to the large propane tank. He takes out the grenade. Puts the rubber bands around it, spoon and all. Grips the grenade in his hand, holding the spoon down, and yanks the pin. And then... Slowly, slowly, Gordy begins releasing his grip, allowing the rubber bands to take on the pressure of the spring- loaded spoon. If they'll do it... if the spoon goes now, Gordy's going up in the blast. Gordy continues to relax his grip. The rubber bands stretch. Stretch more. Keep stretching until they're barely holding the spoon... but they're holding it. Gordy quickly, carefully wires the grenade to the propane tank. Then takes out the Zippo, pulls it apart and removes the lighter fluid-soaked cotton. Holds the cotton just above the grenade and squeezes with his fingers. And...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lighter fluid drops onto the rubber bands.    Gordy squeezes out as much as he can onto them. Then Gordy gets the hell out of there.   He finds cover. Ducks down. And waits.

dialogues.speaker: GRENADE
dialogues.text: The lighter fluid is dissolving the rubber bands.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Gordy suddenly hears a woman's gentle SINGING.    He look in the direction of the sound, and... Gordy sees the attractive Woman and the boy approaching on the road. She's singing a gentle song in Spanish. Gordy's eyes flash with alarm.   He glances at the house.

dialogues.speaker: GRENADE
dialogues.text: The lighter fluid continues dissolving the rubber bands, which are now beginning to lose their elasticity and stretch from the pressure of the spoon.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Gordy looks back at the Woman and boy, closer now, walking toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Anne and Matt wave to him across Madison Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Gordy sees the Woman pull the boy close to her, lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The BOMB EXPLODES, and Anne moves to protect Matt.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: He realizes the horror of what will happen.   And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy bursts from his hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    Stop!   Alto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman and Boy look over in alarm, see Gordy running toward them and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!

dialogues.speaker: GRENADE
dialogues.text: The rubber bands are about to break.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Woman sees Gordy.       Screams toward the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio!!

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: see Gordy running.       They OPEN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: pile out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: STOP FIRING.       Gordy's too close to the Woman and Boy

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: reaches the Woman and Boy now. Pulls them down.       Cov them protectively with his body, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM! A gigantic EXPLOSION lights up the night and utterly destroys the house.

dialogues.speaker: DEBRIS
dialogues.text: rains down for what seems like forever.    Dust fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: opens his eyes. Gets to his hands and knees.     Sees the Woman and Boy are safe, when... A vicious kick in the ribs lifts Gordy off the ground, rolling him away from the Woman and child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard! The Wolf's alive and unhurt.     Angrily punts Gordy agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can kill The Wolf?! A boot in the face this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can kill The Wolf?! A piece of paper has fallen from one of Gordy's pockets and fluttered to the ground nearby. The woman picks it up, and we see... It's the photo of Anne and Matt. The woman stares at the photo a moment, as... Gordy absorbs another blow.    He tries to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my wife and son -- Whack! The Wolf slams the butt of an AK-47 against Gordy's skull. Gordy drops hard. The Wolf reverses the AK. Points it at Gordy's head, about to pull the trigger, when... The Woman lays a hand on The Wolf's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio. The Wolf doesn't take his eyes off Gordy.    The Woman squeezes his arm. Implores him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Wolf glances over. Meets her eyes a moment. Sees the photo in her hand. Glances up into her eyes again. They hold the look. A whole conversation exchanged without words. Then The Wolf turns back to Gordy, lying in a pile on the ground. Beat. To Gordy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just saved by your guardian angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and dank. Excavated clay walls and floor. Heavy door. A bare overhead bulb provides some light. Gordy lies on a metal bed frame. One of his legs is chained to the bed. He's in pain from being kicked -- but the physical aches are nothing compared to the anguish he feels for having failed. The door's unlocked and opens. Daylight streams in from above as The Wolf enters with two guerrilla bodyguards. He moves to the middle of the room. Looks at Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the men in the jail with you in Mompos is dying. He was burned in your explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy just looks at him. The Wolf signals a bodyguard, who crosses to Gordy and frees his leg from the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to kill me? Come and kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodyguards are smiling. Gordy hesitates, then springs for The Wolf, and... The Wolf immediately fells him with a choppy-looking karate combination. The Wolf's no Jet Li -- his style's a throwback, even ugly, but it's well-practiced and brutally effective. Even still, Gordy springs back right away... and The Wolf drops him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Americans think you have all the answers. And really, you're so naive...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gordy comes up swinging. Gordy's a barroom fighter. If he can touch you, you're in trouble. He never gets close. A vicious front kick folds him, and a fist drives him to the floor. The Wolf stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You see one peasant with a gun, and you never ask why he has to have it. You just run to give your billions to the nearest soldiers, no matter how merciless or corrupt they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last kick really hurt Gordy.    He's slow rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm teaching America a lesson... that's why there'll be more bombs... and more families like yours will pay the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolf wants to pique him, but this is pouring gasoline onto fire. Gordy explodes off the ground. The suddenness and fury of the rush catch The Wolf off guard. Gordy drives him backward. Slams him against a wall. Then hooks an arm around the back of The Wolf's neck and drives the other fist like a piston into his abdomen. All his weight behind the punches. Trying to break ribs and crush them into The Wolf's heart, when... A bodyguard slams the butt of an AK into Gordy's kidneys. Gordy takes the blow standing. The guard delivers a second, much harder shot, and Gordy drops to his knees in agony. Beat. The Wolf recovers from the hammer-blows to his midsection. And then... He makes Gordy pay for the punches. Lands blow after blow on Gordy's face. Beats the living shit out of him... and leaves him unconscious on the dirt floor.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: we hear a gentle CLACKING sound.    It's unidentifiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black becomes a BLUR. The BLUR becomes a hazy glimpse of Selena. She's sitting on the metal bed frame nursing Gordy's wounds. The CLACKING sound CONTINUES -- it's made by SEA SHELLS that dangle from a bracelet on Selena's wrist. The shells knock together as she washes Gordy's wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's still in a deep fog from the beating, barely there at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... His wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. The sea shells clack. Gordy loses consciousness again, and everything goes...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: The CLACKING sound CONTINUES.         And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, when Gordy opens his eyes, there's no blurriness. It's a new day. He's better. Selena's walking to him with a tray. The SHELL BRACELET CLACKS as she approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy slowly sits up.       Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why feed me?    Why not just kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you so anxious to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy doesn't have an answer.         Beat.    He tastes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena watches him a moment, troubled by something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men in jail with you in Mompos... They say you talked to a man from the C.I.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not one of them.   I'm here for my own reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena watches him another moment. Decides he's telling the truth. She reaches into a skirt pocket, then extends her hand toward Gordy. He looks up. She's holding the photo of Anne and Matt. Beat. Gordy takes the photo. Looks at his wife and son. Selena sits next to him. Another beat. Then, off the photo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio used to be a teacher. I was a medical aid worker. We met in Guatemala, in an Indian village called Guamaunco. We were married there. Sophia, our daughter was born there. Claudio was kind and loving, and we were happy... We were there four years when the civil war broke out... The guerrillas were all around us, but left us alone... Then they made an attack on the army nearby. The next night, soldiers came to our village. They were led by American 'advisors'... They accused us of helping the rebels. Our women were raped. Our men were tortured. Our homes were burned... We crawled out into the fields, but they threw grenades, and Sophia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena hesitates, choking back her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... my baby girl was hit by shrapnel... she bled to death in Claudio's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into Gordy's eyes. The look says she understands and shares Gordy's pain because she's suffered her own painful loss. She looks away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio joined the guerrillas. When that war ended, we moved to the next war, and the next... Each fight has only deepened his hatred. And poisoned his soul. (beat) He's unable to love anything anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know he was a good man, who's been consumed by rage because of what he lost... Just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kills innocent people. (then) He's planning to kill more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Selena suddenly stands, uncomfortable, not wanting to discuss it. She goes to the door and knocks. OFF Gordy, as the door opens, and Selena exits...

dialogues.speaker: SATELLITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: A laser pointer indicates the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a satellite shot of the Caguan region last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser indicates an area of the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Caguan town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the laser TO:

dialogues.speaker: 269A SECOND IMAGE
dialogues.text: the same night shot with a bright spot in the town area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 2250, we get a large heat-and- light anomaly consistent with an explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the laser TO:

dialogues.speaker: 269B THIRD SATELLITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: a high-resolution, infrared enlargement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the explosive area two minutes later. We got a house blown to shit and burning. We got Colombians in cammies, a gringo down, a woman and kid, and some bodies. This guy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser indicates The Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- is giving all the orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't fucking believe it. That lucky son-of-a-bitch found The Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's paying for it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the laser TO:

dialogues.speaker: 269C FOURTH SATELLITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: an infrared shot of people and vehicles near the burning house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little later, an E.L.C. convoy arrives, and everyone loads up... The convoy travels thirty-two minutes upriver and stops here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the laser TO:

dialogues.speaker: 269D FIFTH SATELLITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: an infrared night shot of parked vehicles, buildings, people, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An E.L.C. compound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like a small village. It's mobile, and it's not just guerrillas -- it's women and kids, too. Here it is by day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the laser TO:

dialogues.speaker: 269E SEVENTH SATELLITE IMAGE
dialogues.text: a day shot of the jungle village.     The laser indicates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houses, barracks, school for the kids, cooking sheds, H.Q., latrines, gun pits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not just hiding The Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is on the map...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Updegraf highlights a map for Brandt, who thinks aloud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's well-sited... can't surprise 'em, so you gotta outgun 'em... (beat) So that's what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna hit it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not just gonna hit it, we're gonna wipe if off the globe. Cats, rats, dogs and mice. If it's moving, it's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitting the whole village could make for a P.R. problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what the Puerto Ricans say. (then, off Updegraf's look) Which part of the word 'war' don't you understand? Our mission down here isn't just about catching The Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What about Gordy Pitt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was told not to be here... The first choppers'll hit it at 2200.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's RAINING buckets. Most of the people inhabiting the village have been driven under roofs or indoors. Guerrillas drag Gordy roughly up out of the bunker into the tropical DOWNPOUR. They march him out into the open. Throw him to the ground. A man draws his pistol as Gordy gets to his hands and knees. The GUERRILLA puts the pistol to Gordy's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, gringo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   He extends a bar of soap with his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bath time... You stink, gringo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guerrillas laugh. Gordy throws the soap in the mud. Gets to his feet. Points his face up into the soothing rain... When he hears ARGUING and looks over to see...

dialogues.speaker: WOLF AND SELENA
dialogues.text: are inside a small house nearby, obviously fighting about something. Selena emphasizes her argument by slapping her hand. The Wolf storms off, and we hear a DOOR SLAM. Selena is left alone, disconsolate, framed in the window. She looks up and sees Gordy outside. Her eyes meet his. OFF their look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's POURING here, too. In b.g., assault preparations are underway in spite of the rain. Brandt checks his watch. Then lights another butt from the one he just smoked. Stares off into the distance, his thoughts intense and far away. Updegraf emerges, crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weather system's intensifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted; beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm's gonna be real bad for at least twelve hours. Here's the data. He hands a paper to Brandt. Cops a puff off Brandt's cigarette while Brandt reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air ops says it's too heavy for the Blackhawks. Also, Sat-Intel is saying the clouds're too thick, and we're blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The creeks are rivers around Caguan. Unless The Wolf's a fish, he's not moving... And there's fresh coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only good thing down here... Put everyone on red till tomorrow night. And then, I don't care if there's a typhoon, I want those fucking rotors turning. Beat. Updegraf goes. Brandt crumples the fax and pitches it. Then sees he got fax ink on his hands. OFF Brandt, holding his mitts out in the rain, trying to wash off the stains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena brings Gordy food. She's extremely subdued. Leaves the tray and starts back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then stops.     Turns back to Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds Gordy's eyes a moment.       Her look is grim, haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; realizes) The United States? Another bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Washington D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in Washington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He had pictures of a building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late.     No one can stop him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got down here from New York...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beat.   She just looks at him, weighing her chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more kids have to die? And for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm his wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't stop it, you're as much to blame as he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to the door and knocks. The door opens. Selena's gone. OFF Gordy, sagging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are lined up to board a flight to Mexico City. FIND a man in line wearing a crisp business suit and tie. The clothes, a haircut and horn-rims have made The Wolf nearly unrecognizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front's moved through.    The night is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water drips from jungle leaves and the eaves of buildings. We see the bustling life of the place, the families, the women and children who live with and support the well-organized and high-tech guerrilla military. The village is simple but decidedly not primitive. These people have generators, a satellite dish and a school with a computer. At night, the school is a TV room. Right now on the tube Daffy's getting his beak blown off.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: pets his child and kisses his wife as he goes off to guard duty.

dialogues.speaker: ELC OFFICER
dialogues.text: talks on satellite phone inside camp headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: MAURO
dialogues.text: sits next to Selena on the porch of a house. He plays with the shells of her bracelet as she stares off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawks, black and menacing, sit on an illuminated tarmac as: Heavily armed troops in black uniforms and assault vests load up. Door gunners check mini-guns. Ground crews yank arming ribbons on rocket pods. A co-pilot in a specially rigged helmet tests his forward mini-gun: wherever he looks, the gun points. Pilots finish checklists, and... Chopper ENGINES start WHINING. ROTORS begin to TURN. The noise mounts to an incredible ROAR. 282   ANGLE - L.O.H. The small helicopter's rotors are also turning. Brandt stands at the chopper door with Updegraf. Slams the magazine on a Glock .45, making sure it's in solid, then slides the pistol into his shoulder holster. He checks his watch. Loud, to Updegraf --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to make The Wolf howl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a last drag on his cigarette, passes the butt to Updegraf to finish and gets in the rear of the L.O.H. as Updegraf scoots clear. 283   L.O.H. THROTTLES UP and SCREAMS away.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWKS
dialogues.text: one by one in quick succession, lift off the deck and follow the L.O.H. into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's on the bed. The guard lets Selena in. She crosses toward the food tray near Gordy... but she's not there for the tray. Moves past it to Gordy's leg and, to Gordy's surprise, begins unlocking the shackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going with you. When Gordy's free --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get out? She hands Gordy a length of pipe secreted in her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard is the only one close. When we're past him, we can slip into the jungle. Mauro's waiting for us there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawks and L.O.H. fly map-of-the-earth, a few feet over triple-canopy rain forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt's in the rear seat wearing a headset. The L.O.H. PILOT, wearing night-vision goggles, checks his GPS, speaks to Brandt via headset --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lead chops are twenty seconds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena whispers to Gordy at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the right... No needless killing. Gordy moves to the right side of the door. Selena knocks. The door swings inward to the left. Selena exits with the tray. The guard reaches to close the door, and Gordy brings the pipe down hard on his head, knocking him out. Gordy retrieves the guard's AK-47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Selena ascend the bunker steps. They stop at the top and peer into the village. An armed guerrilla approaches, unaware of their presence. Gordy fumbles with the AK-47, looking for the safety switch on the strange weapon. Selena reaches over and expertly flicks it off. When... They hear the sound of the CHOPPERS. The guerrilla approaching them stops and looks up. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOM! The first wave of BLACKHAWKS FLASHES OVER the village. Selena and Gordy barely have time to duck as ROCKETS EXPLODE into ground targets, and front and door MINI-GUNS SPIT BULLET-STREAMS that RIP THROUGH people and STRUCTURES. And then the first wave's past.

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLAS
dialogues.text: In the momentary lull after the first wave, guerrillas run to pre-arranged fighting positions. Women and children are screaming.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: pulls Gordy from the steps. They start to run. But not far. Just seconds after the first wave of Blackhawks has left, the second wave hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village and all its details are visible as different shades of green. We see rockets streak toward parked guerrilla vehicles. We see rockets trail fire toward the TV in the school, which is then obliterated in a FIERY EXPLOSION. Wherever the co-pilot looks, the forward MINI-GUN aims its hellish RAIN OF BULLETS. We TRACK WITH a running guerrilla and see him chopped down, then SWIVEL TO a gun pit and watch the men there eat lead.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: He sees the burning school. Watches the continuing slaughter caused by the ROCKETS and MINI-GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circling over the action. Brandt listens to RADIO CHATTER from the Blackhawks. The village is being decimated. Brandt's dream come true.

dialogues.speaker: GUERRILLA
dialogues.text: He LAUNCHES a shoulder-fired SURFACE-TO-AIR-MISSILE (SAM) at the L.O.H., just before a MINI-GUN GETS him. 297   INT. L.O.H. The Pilot sees the SAM launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a button, and... 298   EXT. L.O.H. Two thermite parachute FLARES SHOOT from rocket tubes and IGNITE. Immediately after, the L.O.H. banks. And... The SAM ZIPS past the hot, bright flares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second wave's gone. Gordy and Selena start to run again. Buildings burn. The SCREAMING's endless. Gordy almost trips over the burned body of a child. And now...

dialogues.speaker: THIRD WAVE
dialogues.text: BLASTS in over the treetops. These are the Blackhawks carrying the assault troops.
