They use a "skid 'n' git" maneuver to insert the men, coming in hot, MINI-GUNS BLAZING, barely touching down as the soldiers spill out, then tipping forward to gain speed and quick peeling out in a hard right turn. Gordy and Selena hit the dirt again as the choppers come in and land the troops, and the ground BATTLE ERUPTS. The assault team's GROUND COMMANDER, an American Army Captain, radios his men via comm-link --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going for body count.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY AND SELENA
dialogues.text: There's a break in the fighting nearest them. They jump up and start running for the trees edging the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Selena sprout from the ground and run.     The SOLDIER OPENS FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GORDY AND SELENA
dialogues.text: BULLETS TWITCH the smoke around them. A SLUG PLUCKS the AK from Gordy's hand. They're almost to the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Selena are in his sights.     They'll never mak the trees. When... The Soldier's head WHIPS AROUND TO FACE a guerrilla FIRING at him. He KILLS the guerrilla. Then looks back at Gordy and Selena, and... They're gone.   Into his comm-link --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of GUNFIRE. EXPLOSIONS in the compound flicker light through the dense foliage. Selena leads Gordy to a bush and pulls back leaves, revealing Mauro, cowering fearfully, clutching an old leather doll to his chest. Selena takes Mauro's hand, grabs a small pack lying next to him, then leads Gordy off through the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SEARCHES the jungle. Up ahead, Selena, Mauro and Gordy are visible for a split second when they run through a gap between in the foliage. The Soldier moves after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena, Mauro and Gordy reach the fast-flowing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy spies two empty fuel cans nearby. He gets the cans, throws them in. Then picks up Mauro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena jumps in. Gordy and Mauro follow. They swim for the fuel cans. Gordy, with Mauro clinging to his neck and still clutching the doll, gets an arm over one can. Selena just manages to grab the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He REACHES the river. Sees Gordy, Mauro and Selena bobbing downstream hanging onto the cans. OPENS FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS WHIP the water around Gordy, Mauro and Selena. They hide behind the cans. BULLETS PING OFF the METAL. They're swept through some rocks, blocking them from the Soldier, who FIRES anyway. BULLETS CHIP the STONE. There's one more clear shot after the rocks. They're almost around a bend. The Soldier aims. BANGS! And... Selena's hit.      Gasps.   Gordy looks over, calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena endures the pain.      Hides it behind iron eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hired soldiers can't shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village is a silent, smoking ruin. Everyone who lived there is dead. Troops check the faces of the bodies of the men against the freeze-frame of The Wolf outside the Colombian consulate in New York. The L.O.H. lands.     Brandt's met by the Ground Commande

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of The Wolf. Two people, possibly a third, got away. They're in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt moves back to the L.O.H., gets in.   A moment later, the chopper's up and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy, Mauro and Selena are still floating, hanging onto the cans, when they hear the sound of a HELICOPTER. Gordy looks, sees the L.O.H. flying downstream ten feet off the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the water! (to Mauro) Uno, dos, tres...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a big breath and holds it. Mauro understands and does the same. They go under. So does Selena. 312   INT. L.O.H. The Pilot scans the river with his night-vision goggles. Brandt studies the night-vision monitor in front of him. There's nothing but river. They zoom by the two fuel cans, but see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy, Mauro and Selena surface, gasping for air. 314   INT. L.O.H. The chopper rounds a bend in the river... And there are the two armed guerrilla "customs" boats. The boats open up, and the L.O.H. Pilot banks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The L.O.H. sweeps back in on the customs boats. ROCKETS LAUNCH from the pods. One customs BOAT goes up in a massive EXPLOSION. The other boat scoots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot sees the second boat go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sweeps in again. Triggers more missiles. We watch the second customs boat go the way of the first. Brandt only cares about the primary target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn't have made it this far. Go back upstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the chopper banks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy hears the L.O.H. again.          The three of them again, and... WHOOM! The CHOPPER ZIPS by just overhead. And continues on. A moment later, Gordy, Mauro and Selena re-surface. OFF them, as the copper recedes upriver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy and Selena float side-by-side, still holding onto the cans. Mauro's asleep on Gordy's back, his arms around Gordy's neck. Weakened by her wound, Selena keeps bobbing below the surface. Gordy pulls her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. We just have to keep floating a little bit more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, in the growing light, Gordy sees Selena's blood in the water and realizes she's wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get you outta the river.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: kicks them all to shore.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He climbs out of the river carrying Mauro. As Gordy ascends the bank, Mauro wakes up, terrified. Gordy tries to soothe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esta bien.   Esta bien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mauro squirms free, and immediately, Mauro runs back to his mother. Selena uses sign language to tell him everything's okay. OFF Gordy's surprised look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear or speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy just looks at them a moment. Then moves to Selena. Re: Mauro, as Gordy examines her arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a war orphan. I adopted him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   Gordy finishes checking the bullet wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses part of his shirt to make a pressure bandage.   A he ties it around Selena's arm, she looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where we are. There's a secret trail nearby that leads toward Mompos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy admires this woman's bravery. Selena stands. Mauro's clutching her skirt. Gordy looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you say 'hello'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks at Gordy a moment. She signs "hello" for him, her seashells clacking as she does it. Gordy taps Mauro to get his attention. Tries out the sign for "hello." The boy just looks at him... then reaches out and takes Gordy's hand, shows him the correct way to do it. Gordy tries again. Mauro nods "yes" and smiles. Gordy smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena, Mauro and Gordy follow the secret trail, which ends below a large waterfall. Gordy wonders what they do now, when Selena keeps walking, suddenly disappears behin the ROARING CASCADE. Beat. Gordy follows.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND WATERFALL
dialogues.text: The trail continues, curtained by the falls. Gordy joins Selena and Mauro. Mauro's excited by the experience of being inside the waterfall. Gordy holds him, lets him touch the sheet of water flowing past. They walk to the other side of the waterfall.   Gordy follows Selena and Mauro through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy emerges from the waterfall, and... He's surrounded by Colombian soldiers with guns. More soldiers point guns at Selena and Mauro. Gordy raises his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo soy Americano... Gordy Pitt... Gordy Pitt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio, The Wolf, rides into the capital from Dulles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Blackhawk lands in the clearing. The Colombian soldiers escort Gordy, Selena and Mauro to the chopper. The chopper door opens. Brandt's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's aboard and buckled in. Everyone's tired. The chopper lifts off. Selena's glaring at Brandt, who pushes a headset at her, shouts over the ENGINE WHINE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.B.I.'s on the radio.     Tell 'em everything you know. Gordy's her protector, intervenes.    Grabs Brandt's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get asylum.    And she needs a medic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the asylum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) They'll get it. But she's in my custody till we're done with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Gordy hates going along with Brandt, but has no choice, nods to Selena. She takes the headset. As she puts it on, Brandt sees her pack. Takes it and opens it. He inspects it, then hands it back. Gordy glares at him. Brandt meets his eyes. A long beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't even there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt doesn't reply. Just holds the look a moment longer. Then looks out the window and ignores Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The daily tide of humanity flows through the railway terminal. We see people in business suits, tourists, families, a group of kids on a field trip. And standing in the middle of it all, we FIND...

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDIO
dialogues.text: Now in casual clothes. He's looking over the beautiful and busy station. Contemplating the devastation and death that a bomb planted here would wreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lear stops by a convoy of black government Suburbans parked on the tarmac. FBI agents Joe Phipps and Reggie Dray are among those waiting by the cars. The Lear's door pops, and Gordy, carrying a sleeping Mauro, emerges with Selena. Brandt and a medic follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mauro, still sleeping, is buckled up in the far back seat between Gordy and Selena. Phipps, Dray and Brandt crowd the second row. Phipps extends photos to Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These buildings best match what you described to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena leafs through the photos of various Washington monuments, government buildings, etc. She reaches the last photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recognize anything... I saw only parts of the building... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phipps wants to keep her positive and willing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.   We'll keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think   it's a public place. He said he   wanted the people of America   to feel the terror. 'Terror   is all they understand.' He said   it over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dray) Double up on public venues: museums, theaters, transport... Put in all the extra undercover we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks over at her son sleeping in Gordy's arms. She lovingly brushes the hair off his forehead, rattling her seashells. The leather doll is about to fall from Mauro's fingers. Selena takes the doll and puts it into her bag. Then looks out at the passing scenery. OFF Selena, in the land of her husband's enemy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy slows outside the Latin American Institute. An attached garage opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Suburban turns into the garage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inter-agency headquarters for our efforts in Latin America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's secure, and we can coordinate all departments here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF which, as they're swallowed up by the dark garage --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Brandt, Phipps, Dray, Selena and Gordy -- along with the rest of the entourage -- walk through the interagency nerve center. Gordy carries Mauro, still asleep. They stop at the door to a large conference room. Selena's ushered in. Gordy starts to follow. Phipps stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people will debrief you in another room... We'll take the boy to a safe house across the street... He'll be well cared for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy exchanges a look with Selena. Beat. She nods her reluctant approval. Gordy hands the boy to an agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio opens the door of a cheap rental garage in an old commercial strip. He steps inside. There's a rental van and a big Ducati motorbike against a wall. Claudio straps a black bag onto the bike, then rolls it out and shuts the garage. Pulls on helmet and STARTS the BIKE. As Claudio speeds into traffic --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Selena is seated at a table covered with photographs, Washington, D.C. coffee table books, guide books, etc. Brandt, Phipps, et al stand around her. Phipps flips through the pages of a large coffee table book for Selena to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No... No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That book's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs another.    Opens it to the first photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small conference room devoted to everything having to do with the interagency interest in The Wolf. Photos of evidence, time lines, charts, etc. cover the walls. Gordy's tired, being debriefed by two FBI AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Did Claudio leave with anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was underground. I couldn't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear anything about his contacts in the United States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security tightens all over the city.    Among the images see: A forklift places huge planters -- really decorative barricades -- to re-route traffic near vital buildings.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCOVER PEOPLE
dialogues.text: with earpieces patrol public structures.       Some lead that sniff for explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio weaves the Ducati through heavy traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phipps flips to the last photo in the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No... He reaches for another book. As he does, he topples a stack. Selena's eyes fix on one book cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had that book! Let me see it! Phipps hands it to her. It's a guidebook to Washington. Selena flips through it. Stops at a photo.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: It's of the redesigned lobby of Union Station.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Selena glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Union Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it under total surveillance. Get a bomb team in there with dogs. Make 'em seeing-eye dogs if you have to. And pull whatever security video they have for the last two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not just shut it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we spook him, we don't know what his secondary target'll be. Dray gets on the horn.   Beat.      To Brandt and Phipps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man sits on a bench. He's wearing sunglasses and a baseball cap. He puts a shoulder bag on the bench, takes something out, then gets up and walks away, when... Suddenly, two tourists and a hot dog vendor are right on him. One of 'em jams a concealed gun jammed into his ribs, while the other two hustle him forcefully to a van. He's shoved inside. His bag's tossed in. The van drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents press the man hard to the floorboards. His bag's tossed. It's empty. The guy's clean. It's not Claudio. OFF the agents, holding an innocent man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena watches as Phipps plays a surveillance video of Union Station. Phipps suddenly freezes the image. Zooms in on a man in the middle of the crowd. Claudio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was there yesterday. Just stood there and left... So far, the dogs haven't found anything, so maybe we're ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his time. Like he told you, he enjoys it. Beat. Selena's overwhelmed by the experience of seeing her husband on the tape, by her betrayal of him. She grows queasy. Leans on the table for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I think I'm going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt opens a door to a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena grabs her pack and rushes in. When the door's closed, Phipps turns to Dray, indicates monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get copies of this freeze frame to all the undercover people and the sniper teams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody caps him until we get that bomb tagged. After that, I don't give a shit what happens to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dray goes. There's a long beat.     Brandt looks at the freeze frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always hid his face. Why's he giving us a clear picture now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   The bathroom TOILET FLUSHES.   Selena emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd feel better if I could rest a little and see my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phipps nods to Brandt, who turns to two of his agents, one a female.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's on his feet, looking at The Wolf evidence, etc., on the walls. He can't keep his eyes off it. It's reminiscent of what he constructed on his wall at home. The second Agent's not in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Let's go through it again, Mr. Pitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's eyes go to numbered evidence photo.       It's a picture of a seashell. He points to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the number on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent refers to an index sheet as the Second Agent returns. He's holding a document. To Gordy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pitt, you said Selena told you she had a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was killed in Guatemala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to tests on the blood we drew on the plane, Selena's Rhesus F-six. She's genetically barren. She couldn't possibly have had kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy doesn't understand.     Why would she have lied? The first Agent finds what he's looking for in the index.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number eleven, small seashell with a hole in it... That was found in the getaway car used in the bombing in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Gordy's face...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: There's a gap where one of the shells is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy blasts through the building.    As he runs...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Selena expertly flicks the safety off on the AK-47.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Phipps addresses Gordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think the bomb was triggered by a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see a cell phone when you ran into him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Selena and Claudio argue inside the house. Selena slaps the back of one hand into the palm of the other.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The Wolf does the same hand slap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena emerges with the two CIA agents.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BLOCK
dialogues.text: Claudio sits on his parked motorcycle. He sees Selena emerge. Drops his helmet visor and STARTS the BIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy bursts in, sees Selena's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Selena?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went to see her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lying!   She's The Wolf! Gordy runs out.   Phipps and others follow.      OFF Bran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandt bursts in. He searches. Finds Mauro's leather doll behind the toilet. The head's detached. Brandt looks inside, and... We see a block of reddish Semtex plastic explosive and a chemical fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody out!     Clear this floor! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy jumps downstairs, four steps at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Institute personnel evacuate offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena and the agents cross the street toward the safe house. Claudio GUNS the BIKE toward them. Selena hears the BIKE. Sees Claudio coming. Uses the front edge of her hand to strike the female agent hard in the throat. The agent falls to her knees trying to suck air through a crushed windpipe. Selena whip-kicks the other agent to the ground. Claudio brakes hard next to Selena, who takes the female agent's pistol and spare magazines as...

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: bursts outside, followed by Phipps et al. Claudio OPENS FIRE with a MACHINE PISTOL, hitting two agents and scattering Gordy, Phipps and the rest. Selena SHOOTS the two escort people dead, then BLASTS away at the other people pouring out of the institute as she straddles the Ducati behind Claudio, and the powerful BIKE SCREAMS off down the street. Gordy jumps to his feet and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A MASSIVE EXPLOSION spits flame out of the windows of the building's top floor.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE
dialogues.text: dive for cover.   Debris showers the street.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: STREET IN FRONT OF INSTITUTE
dialogues.text: runs one way in the direction the Ducati's headed. Far down the block, the bike turns right onto another one-way street.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: spots an alley on his right and turns into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's now moving parallel to Claudio and Selena, sprinting hard toward another one-way street, which crosses the alley ahead. He doesn't know if he'll intercept the bike, but it's his only shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claudio GUNS the BIKE down the second street, parallel to Gordy's alley. He and Selena reach an intersection with the one-way street. A right turn will complete the "U" and take them back toward Gordy. Straight ahead, the street they're on is one-way in the opposite direction. Claudio hangs right and cranks on the speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's almost to the next street. He can hear the WHINE of the DUCATI growing closer. When... A truck stops ahead of him and blocks the alley. Gordy veers into a walkway between buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parked   car suddenly pulls out in front of the speedin Ducati.    Claudio can't swerve around it. SLAMS ON the BRAKES.    The car's driver, frightened and flustered by the near   collision, is slow moving out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy bursts through a gate. Sees back steps leading to the open door of a second-story over a garage and charges the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of the car finally backs up. Claudio aims the DUCATI through a narrow gap and ZOOMS on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy blows into the second story of the garage, a converted old-time carriage barn. He's in the old hayloft. On the opposite side of the loft, a double door built for loading in hay is open above the street. Gordy sprints for the opening, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ducati tears around traffic, when... Gordy leaps out of the hayloft, launches himself off a parked car as the DUCATI SCREAMS past, and... He just manages to grab Selena and yank her off the bike. Selena's arms are wrapped around Claudio -- when Gordy rips her out of the saddle, Claudio goes, too. The three of them tumble to the ground as the speeding Ducati spins, flips and disintegrates.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDIO
dialogues.text: in leathers and a helmet. He takes the fall better than Selena. Gets to his feet. Looks for the guns they dropped. Before Claudio can get to a gun, Gordy's on him. They grapple. Gordy pounds Claudio hard. Once. Twice. When...

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: side-kicks Gordy. He sags. She front-kicks a heel into his spine and between his shoulder blades. Gordy lets go of Claudio and drops. Selena's relentless, kicks Gordy repeatedly as...

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDIO
dialogues.text: gets the pistol. Turns.   Aims the gun two-handed at Gordy's head, and BANG!

dialogues.speaker: DRAY
dialogues.text: SHOOTS Claudio dead from the mouth of the alleyway down the block. The first SHOT CRACKS the back of Claudio's helmet. The second SHOT punches through and exits his visor in a bright red mist of blood.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: bolts.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: DRAY
dialogues.text: EMPTIES a CLIP at Selena, but he doesn't have a clear shot and misses.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: sees a walkway between houses and turns in.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Gordy turns in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena has ten yards on Gordy, but he's closing. She knows she can't outrun him in a straight line. Jukes through a gate into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shovel lies in the grass. Selena scoops it up and in one motion, spins back toward the gate, launches it blade-first with all her strength, timing it perfectly, as Gordy runs through the gate, and...

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: just barely evades the sharp shovel edge headed for his face. It doesn't hurt him, but it stops him, and Selena breaks toward an open door of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena blasts into the bottom floor, runs through a playroom. Gordy's right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: mounts a stairwell. A girl's descending. Selena grabs a pigtail and flings her down the stairs, and...

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: gets there just in time to keep the screaming girl from falling all the way to the bottom. He sits the uninjured girl down and continues on.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: runs toward the living room, which is undergoing a renovation. Without stopping, she tears through the plastic covering the doorway to seal in dust from the rest of the house. She topples what she can into Gordy's way. Throws nails down behind her. Grabs a circular saw and hurls it back at Gordy, just missing him and shattering a large wall mirror. Selena's a soldier, taught to pick up and use whatever weapons she finds as she moves through a battlefield -- this battlefield gives her a crowbar, which she keeps as she runs out through plastic covering the other doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: leads into the dining room. Selena runs in. Gordy's right on her heels. Selena pulls down dining room chairs in front of Gordy. He vaults one but trips over the second and falls.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: blows through a swinging door into the kitchen, slamming into a Hispanic maid, who's coming to investigate all the noise. Both women tumble. Selena gets right back on her feet. She breaks out a window with the crowbar and exits onto a fire escape as Gordy blasts in from the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 394

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window Selena slipped through easily is small for Gordy. He gets hung up on the glass, losing precious seconds. Selena's already halfway up when Gordy hits the fire escape steps. The fire escape ends at a top floor window. Selena BREAKS out the GLASS with the crowbar and goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena's in a teenager's bedroom. The teenager's got headphones on, oblivious to everything. Selena darts through a bathroom into a second bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: 396A GORDY
dialogues.text: enters the first bedroom behind her.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: IN GARDENING CLOTHES and holding a digging tool stands on a stairwell landing, alarmed and confused by the chaos she hears in her house. She had started down the stairs but now has turned back at the sound of the WINDOW BREAKING on the top floor. Calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: runs into the hallway at the top of the stairs, above the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?   What are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: sees an open rooftop door at the top of a flight of stairs and charges upward without answering.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY'S
dialogues.text: in the hallway a second later. Meets the Woman In Gardening Clothes, who's now come up the stairs. She screams. Swipes at him with the digging tool, making three deep scratches in his face. Gordy doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the woman was gardening, tending a rooftop flower bed. Selena emerges, crushes plants as she runs to the next town house roof. Gordy hits the roof behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: As Selena runs from rooftop to rooftop along the row of town houses, we see her warrior determination and discipline. She's thinking ahead and she never hesitates. Her big problem is she's being pursued by an e well-trained and determined firefighter. And he's not far back. One tumble, and he'll catch her. Selena strains harder.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: vaults a gap.   Moments later, Gordy vaults it.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: finally runs out of roof. She looks down. A fire escape ladder leads down to an interior, ground-level courtyard of a small foreign embassy. Still holding the crowbar, Selena takes the ladder down.

dialogues.speaker: 405A MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Gordy reaches the ladder. Selena's ahead of him by a floor, hurrying down two rungs at a time. Gordy doesn't fuck with the rungs. Just swings over the edge of the roof, grabs the side-rails lightly with his hands, squeezes the rails with the insides of his boots and lets gravity take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire escape leads down to a second-story balcony running around the inside wall of the courtyard. Twin staircases lead from the balcony to ground level, where, across the slate-paved car court, a wrought-iron gate opens onto the street. Gordy hits the balcony a half-second after Selena. He grabs her. Selena swings the crowbar to break his arm. Gordy has to let go. Selena heads for the stairs leading to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY'S
dialogues.text: got one chance to intercept Selena. The balcony's too high for him to jump, but the courtyard's ringed with trees -- they're not close, but they're not far, either. Not for a man craving revenge for the deaths of his wife and son, a man who also slides down fire poles for a living. Gordy runs down the balcony. Gains speed. Jumps. Launches off the balcony railing. And hurtles himself at the trunk of a medium-sized tree. He hits the trunk. Hangs on. And slides to the ground. And now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's between Selena and the only way out.   And there's n way she's getting past him. But that's not what Selena's thinking. She attacks with the crowbar, and Gordy can only retreat in the face of the vicious onslaught. He finds a nearby garbage can. It's full, heavy, but he manages to lift it, spilling garbage as he uses the can to block the blows from the crowbar. The CROWBAR THWOCKS into the can over and over, the sound ECHOING LOUDLY in the small courtyard. Selena swings again, and Gordy moves to block the hit. It's a feint. She swings under the can and hits a leg. It hurts like hell, he stumbles, but he stays on his feet, still holding the can. Selena goes for his head.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gordy raises the can. Thwock! Thwock! The can's all dents. There's garbage everywhere. She feints high and then swings low again, a wicked blow to the knee. Gordy stumbles badly this time. Selena breaks for the gate. Gordy sees her and, with all his might slings the can across the slate pavers, and... The can takes Selena's legs out from under her. She falls hard. Gets back to her feet quickly and starts to run, when... Gordy hits her like a linebacker. Slams Selena against a brick wall. Gets behind her and slips a mighty arm around her thin neck. Selena squirms hard, kicks backward, going for the balls, kneecaps, insteps, doing whatever she can to hurt Gordy and get free. But she's not in a position to do a lot of damage -- and she'd have to kill him before he'd let go. Gordy's got his arm locked in a police chokehold around Selena's neck. Uses his weight to force the smaller woman down onto her knees. Presses her harder, till she's sitting back on her legs. Selena can't drop out of the hold, and her legs are immobilized. All she can do is scratch. But Gordy's oblivious. They're alone in the courtyard. Body to body. Head to head. He's pumped with fury and hatred. He tightens the chokehold. Hisses in her ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; with contempt) One woman, one boy -- they mean nothing next to the thousands who've been slain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy hears it.    It only drives him to a deeper fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's blind with rage. Chokes her neck hard. Summoning all the power in him, first to shut off her air and blood, and then to continue squeezing, relishing her every dying moment, until he's snuffed out the life of the person who took Anne and Matt from him. And...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He can't... it's all he's wanted since he saw Anne and Matt die, but now he can't do it. He's a firefighter. He saves lives. If he kills Selena, Gordy crosses into her world, into Brandt's world, into the brutal nightmare destroying Colombia and all the places like it, and becom part of that sadness and death... And... Gordy relaxes the chokehold enough so she can breathe. Selena gasps for air. The impulse to murder has left Gordy. There's a new resolve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killing ends here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   Selena pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will never end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under which an EMBASSY SECURITY GUARD emerges from the building. He sees Gordy and Selena -- a large man holding a smaller woman in a chokehold. Draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy looks up at the nervous guard pointing his gun. Selena screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go, or you're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to shoot. Gordy has no choice.       As he let Selena go and stands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold us both till the police get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. Selena stomps a heel into the Guard's knee, crushing it, then twists the gun from his hands. She points it at him and pulls the trigger, and... In his agitation, the guard never took the safety off. Selena glances quickly at the gun to find the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the same moment, Gordy grabs the crowbar from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SELENA
dialogues.text: flicks off the safety and points the gun again.

dialogues.speaker: GORDY
dialogues.text: hurls the crowbar with all his might, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUN FIRES, just as the crowbar hits Selena, spoiling her aim. The bullet creases the guard's arm. Selena recovers. And the next BULLET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't hers. It's from Phipps' GUN. It takes Selena in the middle of the back and explodes her heart on its way through her body. She's dead on her feet. Her body crumples to the ground and empties its blood in a large pool that quickly spreads over the slate.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER AGENTS
dialogues.text: move in to help the guard as Phipps holsters his pistol. He walks to Gordy. The two men share a long, silent look. It's over. Gordy looks again at Selena's body in its pool of blood. Then turns and goes.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDT'S
dialogues.text: entering the courtyard as Gordy walks out.   Brandt's see Selena. He's smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy hits him. One of the jackhammer blows he slammed into Claudio in the bunker. A hard fist deep in the gut that drives all the wind from Brandt and drops him to his knees. Beat. Gordy's voice is cold and hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no better than she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Gordy goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy cranks away on the repaired ice cream maker. He's wearing civvies. He stops cranking, spoons out a huge dollop into a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy hands the bowl to Mauro, who's playing in the front seat of the pumper. Mauro tastes it. Thumbs up. Gordy smiles. Mike and the other men on Gordy's old shift are watching. To Gordy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be good to get you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy turns to them. Looks into the faces of these men, the people closest to him in the world. Beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordy's still in pain, still missing the wife and son he'll never see again. But Gordy's gonna be alright. Mauro's gonna be with him. There'll be fires to put out and lives to save and basketball games and the multitude of miseries and joys the firefighters in Spanish Harlem see each and every day. As we PULL BACK, OUT and AWAY from the old brick edifice from which the big red truck will come, bringing help...
